newsitem.title: USA: Galoob acquires all rights to Micro Machines.
newsitem.headline: Galoob acquires all rights to Micro Machines.

text.p: Galoob Toys Inc said Monday it had acquired all rights to the miniature vehicles and accessories of the Micro Machines brand, a toy line whose sales have surpassed $900 million since introduced in 1987.
Galoob said in a statement that the pact will result in a second quarter charge to earnings of about $16.2 million after tax, or $0.90 per share.
The company also said there will be an additional charge of about $2.7 million after tax to be spread over the next five years.
Galoob has paid royalties on some of these sales to Funmaker, which licensed a concept to Galoob that contributed to the origination of Micro Machines.

Galoob said purchase of the rights eliminates all future royalty payments to Funmaker, effective March 31. It said the pact also ends all litigation between it and Funmaker over past royalties and the extent of Funmaker's rights in Micro Machines.

"Galoob is delighted to have gained complete control over our core brand. The current and anticipated growth of the Micro Machines brand makes the acquisition of these rights a particularly timely and attractive long-term investment in our future," Galoob chief executive Mark Goldman said in the statement.
Galoob shares closed Monday off 3/4 at 17-7/8.
